item.title: US cities warn of wave of unpaid parking phishing texts
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: US cities are warning of an ongoing mobile phishing campaign pretending to be texts from the city's parking violation departments about unpaid parking invoices, that if unpaid, will incur an additional $35 fine per day. [...]

item.title: New Chirp tool uses audio tones to transfer data between devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new open-source tool named 'Chirp' transmits data, such as text messages, between computers (and smartphones) through different audio tones. [...]

item.title: Developer guilty of using kill switch to sabotage employer's systems
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A software developer has been found guilty of sabotaging his ex-employer's systems by running custom malware and installing a "kill switch" after being demoted at the company. [...]

item.title: Undocumented commands found in Bluetooth chip used by a billion devices
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The ubiquitous ESP32 microchip made by Chinese manufacturer Espressif and used by over 1 billion units as of 2023 contains undocumented commands that could be leveraged for attacks. [...]

item.title: YouTubers extorted via copyright strikes to spread malware
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Cybercriminals are sending bogus copyright claims to YouTubers to coerce them into promoting malware and cryptocurrency miners on their videos. [...]

item.title: US seizes $23 million in crypto linked to LastPass breaches
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: U.S. authorities have seized over $23 million in cryptocurrency linked to the theft of $150 million from a Ripple crypto wallet in January 2024. Investigators believe hackers who breached LastPass in 2022 were behind the attack. [...]

item.title: Unpatched Edimax IP camera flaw actively exploited in botnet attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A critical command injection vulnerability impacting the Edimax IC-7100 IP camera is currently being exploited by botnet malware to compromise devices. [...]

item.title: Employee charged with stealing unreleased movies, sharing them online
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: A Memphis man was arrested and charged with stealing DVDs and Blu-ray discs of unreleased movies and sharing ripped digital copies online before their release. [...]

item.title: US charges Garantex admins with money laundering, sanctions violations
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The administrators of the Russian Garantex crypto-exchange have been charged in the United States with facilitating money laundering for criminal organizations and violating sanctions. [...]

item.title: Data breach at Japanese telecom giant NTT hits 18,000 companies
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Japanese telecommunication services provider NTT Communications Corporation (NTT) is warning almost 18,000 corporate customers that their information was compromised during a cybersecurity incident. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: North Korean hackers join Qilin ransomware gang
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says a North Korean hacking group tracked as Moonstone Sleet has deployed Qilin ransomware payloads in a limited number of attacks. [...]

item.title: Microsoft says malvertising campaign impacted 1 million PCs
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has taken down an undisclosed number of GitHub repositories used in a massive malvertising campaign that impacted almost one million devices worldwide. [...]
